intro: Koanophyllon kavanayense, commonly known as the Kavanayen silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its silvery, fuzzy foliage that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small, tubular yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Koanophyllon kavanayense is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
